intro: Pycnosorus eremaeus, commonly known as the desert pycnosorus, is a rare and specialized plant adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth form and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils in desert regions of North America. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
